string-array.name: bldg_desc
string-array.item: The Art Building (AB) - The Art Department is located in the Art Building.
Bennett Hall (BT) - Information Technology Services is located in Bennett Hall. Need to reset your password? Visit BT104.
Benton Hall (BE) - Home to the School of Applied Studies which includes Criminal Justice and Social Work.

Bradbury Thompson Alumni Center - Located on Washburn’s campus off 17th and Jewell, the Bradbury Thompson Alumni Center sits across the street from White Concert Hall and Mulvane Art Museum. The facility is designed to serve the needs of alumni, the university and the Topeka community.
Garvey - Home of the Theatre and Music Departments.
Henderson Commons (HC) - Home to the School of Business as well as History, Political Science, Psychology and Sociology/Anthropology.
KBI Building - Kansas Bureau of Investigation
Law Building - Home to the School of Law.

Mabee Library - Mabee Library is located in the center of campus between Moore Bowl/Yager Stadium and Henderson Learning Resources Center. The ibrary was completed during the 1977-78 school year and named in honor of J.E. and L.E. Mabee of Oklahoma. Before their deaths, Mr. and Mrs. Mabee established a foundation to provide money for educational and religious institutions in the Midwest region. Washburn University applied for and received a grant from the Mabee Foundation to build a new library during the rebuilding phase after the 1966 tornado, which destroyed numerous buildings and damaged many others. - From: "A Brief History of the Washburn University Libraries" By Martha Imparato, University Archivist
The Memorial Union - A great place to study or relax, and get some food.
Morgan Hall (MO) - The home to Math and English as well as the president\'s office, the various Dean\'s Offices, and many other administrative offices.
Stoffer Hall (ST) - Home to Biology, Chemistry, Computer Information Sciences and Physics.

Washburn University Foundation- Working collaboratively with Washburn University, the Washburn University Foundation, as the designated alumni relations, fundraising, and gift-stewardship organization for Washburn University, is committed to leading and coordinating the efforts to expand the University’s base of volunteer support and engagement and private financial support.
Yager Stadium - The football and soccer fields.
